alert.note: Alert for Covington; Escambia (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 3:51PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT EASTERN ESCAMBIA...SOUTHWESTERN COVINGTON...NORTHWESTERN OKALOOSA AND NORTHEASTERN SANTA ROSA COUNTIES THROUGH 430 PM CDT... At 351 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms 6 miles north of Baker, or 11 miles northwest of Crestview, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Crestview and Baker. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
